issue.title: [C++] Add re2 library to core arrow / ARROW_WITH_RE2
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-10541](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10541). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
For https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10195 we need the re2 linked into the core arrow library, as discussed:
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8459#pullrequestreview-508337720>

This might be good to put under an ARROW_WITH_RE2 CMake option, maybe default on when ARROW_COMPUTE=ON?

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10541?focusedCommentId=17238075) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
I think a minimum to do here is adding a `ARROW_WITH_RE2` option (and then we can still see if we also want something like `ARROW_COMPUTE_STRINGS` that turns on both re3 and utf8proc). 

cc `[~uwe]` `[~apitrou]`
